messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Polls
messages.msgSnippet: Not here in Missouri. Shawn ... Not here in GA. I take the kids with me when I vote, so they at least have an idea what s going on. Nisha List Posting
messages.messageBody:
Not here in Missouri. Shawn

Nisha <nishamartin@...> wrote:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "alexandriapalonia"
<alexandriapalonia@h...> wrote:
>
> This being Election Day and all, I thought I'd ask who has "Kids's
> Vote" in their state?

Not here in GA. I take the kids with me when I vote, so they at
least have an idea what's going on.
Nisha

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Polls
messages.msgSnippet: ***... Kids s Vote in their state? *** My son would be insulted by Kids Vote.  He s fairly radical.   He thinks kids should be able to vote and believes
messages.messageBody:
***..."Kids's Vote" in their state? ***

My son would be insulted by "Kids Vote." He's fairly radical. <g> He
thinks kids should be able to vote and believes he's being denied his
constitutional right. If he was on the Simpsons right now the
"independent thought alarms" would be screaming. <g>

I'm giving my vote to Dylan this year. I'll sign in at the polls and
once were in the booth he can fill out the ballot.

He's always come with me to vote and they give kids ballots to fill out
if they want them, but there's no count of kid votes here as far as I
know.

Did anyone watch the Dead Ringers Election special? Very funny!

Deb L

messages.subject: Polls
messages.msgSnippet: This being Election Day and all, I thought I d ask who has Kids s Vote in their state?  (Where they provide ballots for children at the polls and announce
messages.messageBody:
This being Election Day and all, I thought I'd ask who has "Kids's
Vote" in their state? (Where they provide ballots for children at the
polls and announce the kid vote winners on the 6pm news). We didn't
in NY or LA, but did in NC and MD.
Alex
